column1: The main symptom is a reddish bump (papule) that slowly grows into a purplish and painful nodule.
The health care provider will perform a physical examination and ask about your symptoms.
Antibiotics are used to treat this infection.
You may need several months of treatment with more than one antibiotic.
Swimming pool granulomas can usually be cured with antibiotics.
The disease may be harder to treat in patients whose immune system is not working well.
